info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 06 at 8:27PM CDT until August 06 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN JASPER AND NORTHERN RICHLAND COUNTIES... At 827 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over West Liberty, or 8 miles southeast of Newton, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ste. Marie. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central and southeastern Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
